questions.question_text:
A user is participating in a weight-loss challenge and needs to keep track of fitness activities, locations, distances, and calories burned during a specific time period. The user wants to be able to listen to music while participating in the challenge.
Which of the following would the user MOST likely need to purchase to meet these requirements?

comments.content: your totally right but dhcp reservation wasnt listed

For anyone curious what question he is referring to check 179

I think there is a misunderstanding. It doesn't mean DHCP reservation is wrong. 179 ask what was the best method to avoid IP conflict. In general DHCP reservation is preferable because it automates and reduces the chances of IP conflict. If you are given a question about IP conflict and these two options appear, go for a DHCP reservation. 

CompTIA is aware of this hence why they only leave you with static IP in the question.

discussion.content:
Just so everyone realizes how much bullsh*t this site is, the earlier question in the series where people are all effed in the head about whether its "dhcp reservation for the printer" or "set static address on printer", now we KNOW that dhcp reserve is wrong for that other question

honestly this is garbage just pure trash. I hate this effing site but its the best one at least there is discussion.
you can also just set the printer to static IP outside of DHCP range so you don't even need to do a reservation

in some reading I've seen that putting IP static address is the right option to choose AND do DHCP reservation as good practice to avoid other machine gets the same IP address. What do you think? For me The answer depends on the context of the question.
With lesser information provided in the scenario and choices...process of elimination works.

choices.B: Disable the firewall on the user's machine
choices.C: Set a static IP address on the printer
choices.A: Run Windows Update on the user's machine
choices.D: Reinstall the printer with vendor-provided drivers

questions.question_text:
A user reports being unable to print to a network-based all-in-one printer. The issue consistently appears after power outages.
Which of the following should a technician perform to resolve the issue?

A technician is troubleshooting an issue with a printer that is directly attached to a user's workstation. The printer is powered on but will not print. The user claims nothing has changed on the computer, and the printer was working earlier in the day.
Which of the following should the technician do NEXT to determine the cause of the issue?

discussion.content: I've realized that the questions related with 'what the technician would do next' implies an extra revision instead of changing something that would cost time or money and will possibly needs to be taken but AFTER exhausting revisions.

comments.content: that's true i have noticed that
Your so right. I've started noticing that as well!
Most real life problems on the workfloor usually relate to the simple answers, ex: a cable is not fit correctly.
you know what? youre kinda right and I'm seeing this too.

discussion.content: So the key words that helped me are "the user claims nothing has changed"... but as a technician you still have to check everything yourself by physical examination of the WS and printer for obvious issues.
Physically examine the workstation and printer for any obvious issues

choices.D: Reseat all the printer cables and restart the user's workstation
choices.A: Order a new printer for the user and decommission the current printer
choices.B: Update the printer drivers in the workstation's OS
choices.C: Physically examine the workstation and printer for any obvious issues

questions.question_text:
A company is concerned about the security of sensitive data on a laptop a user frequently takes off-site.
Which of the following enables hardware encryption to secure user data?

discussion.content: PM (Trusted Platform Module) is a computer chip (microcontroller) that can securely store artifacts used to authenticate the platform (your PC or laptop). These artifacts can include passwords, certificates, or encryption keys
thanks windows 11 for getting me oh so familiar with TPM
I had a similar question....the difference is they used Molex instead of EIDE.

Selected Answer: B
24-pin ATX motherboard power plug; pins 11, 12, 23 and 24 form a detachable separate four-pin plug, making it backward-compatible with 20-pin ATX receptacles 
- Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ATX

This is the reason that 24 pin adapter is correct for the other question and molex is wrong, P4 is specialized 12v x 2 only(2 yellow wires) connector, while a Molex connector usually has both 12v(yellow) and 5 v(red) wires on it.
This same question displays Molex connector as an option on other sites and even one on this site when I looked it up. Not sure why that choice is not in this question.

comments.content: because molex is not a correct answer for the other question either... they are both "24 pin adapter" because the P4 is pared with the 20 pin plug to make the 24 pin adapter.

discussion.content: The last 4 pins on the 24p connector for mobo power is a 4p, no different than the cpu 4p connector. Molex is technically a 4 pin connector with 12v on the rail, but not refered to as 4p

P4 connector. These plugs are used to connect motherboards with onboard CPUs to power supplies while EIDE port is an enhanced version of the old IDE peripheral connection standard commonly used for hard drives and other storage media with computers. I think correct answer is well Molex or in this scenario 24 pin connector.

questions.question_text: Which of the following has a P4 connector to provide a 12V output?
